title: Hiromasa Yamamoto
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Yamamoto was born in <a href="Okazaki%2C%20Aichi">Okazaki</a> on June 5, 1979. After graduating from <a href="Shimizu%20Higashi%20High%20School">Shimizu Higashi High School</a>, he joined <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a> club <a href="J%C3%BAbilo%20Iwata">Júbilo Iwata</a> in 1998. However he could hardly play in the match behind <a href="Tomoaki%20Ogami">Tomoaki Ogami</a> and <a href="Arno%20van%20Zwam">Arno van Zwam</a> until early 2002. In September 2002, he became a regular goalkeeper instead van Zwam. However he could hardly play in the match in 2003. In September 2003, van Zwam left the club and Yamamoto became a regular goalkeeper again. However he could hardly play in the match behind new member <a href="Yohei%20Sato">Yohei Sato</a> in 2004. In September 2004, he moved to <a href="Vissel%20Kobe">Vissel Kobe</a> on loan. However he could hardly play in the match behind <a href="Seiji%20Honda">Seiji Honda</a> and <a href="Makoto%20Kakegawa">Makoto Kakegawa</a>. In 2005, he returned to Júbilo Iwata. However the club gained <a href="Japan%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> goalkeeper <a href="Yoshikatsu%20Kawaguchi">Yoshikatsu Kawaguchi</a> and Yamamoto could not play at all in the match behind Kawaguchi. In 2007, he moved to <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a> club <a href="Cerezo%20Osaka">Cerezo Osaka</a>. Although he could not play at all in the match behind <a href="Motohiro%20Yoshida">Motohiro Yoshida</a> in 2007, he battles with <a href="Takashi%20Aizawa">Takashi Aizawa</a> for the position and played many matches. In 2009, he moved to J2 club <a href="Ehime%20FC">Ehime FC</a>. He played as regular goalkeeper until late 2010 because regular goalkeeper <a href="Yusuke%20Kawakita">Yusuke Kawakita</a> got hurt. However Kawakita came back in late 2010 and Yamamoto could hardly play in the match. In 2011, he moved to <a href="Japanese%20Regional%20Leagues">Regional Leagues</a> club <a href="SC%20Sagamihara">SC Sagamihara</a>. He retired end of 2011 season.
